channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: There’s a paradox at the root of the growing crypto ecosystem—a disconnect between the technology and the economics https://t.co/lgK0ze1tEV?
A former Japanese-American internment camp in Colorado, the Amache Confinement Center, may soon become as a national historic site https://t.co/IJjIWwNnx0

Efforts to extinguish a fire on a drifting ship in the Atlantic Ocean are being complicated by the large number of electric vehicles on board, the experts contracted to salvage the vessel said https://t.co/HLOrA8wEOI

China’s more explicit warnings in recent days against a Russian invasion of Ukraine show how Beijing is trying to both build a partnership with the Kremlin while preserving ties with Washington https://t.co/2gnCMa1PCI
Fewer Oreos in some packages, a 3% surcharge on a restaurant bill, no room service—companies are finding ways to pass costs on to customers without raising prices. https://t.co/vFYBnjmSxi

Heard on the Street: Hong Kong’s Covid-19 strategy is unraveling and the city is likely to witness significant fatalities soon. How the city reached this point says a lot about its changing politics—and future as a business hub. https://t.co/2IEfXwp7Hg
Queen Elizabeth has tested positive for Covid-19. The 95-year-old British monarch is experiencing “mild cold-like symptoms,” Buckingham Palace said. https://t.co/6p1uYe7BtU

Russia will extend its military drills with Belarus involving some 30,000 troops near Ukraine’s border, the government in Minsk said, citing an uptick in violence in eastern Ukraine https://t.co/fdc6UG7IZg
Australia accused the Chinese navy of shining a military-grade laser at a surveillance plane flying over its territorial waters https://t.co/P88yO8XPwo
Firefighting tug boats were headed toward a 60-ton ship ablaze in the Atlantic Ocean that is carrying thousands of Porsche, Bentley and Volkswagen vehicles to U.S. dealers https://t.co/OIlXqdCocI
A habitual late riser discovered the strange joy of waking up at 4 a.m. It’s not for everyone, but it’s working for him. https://t.co/ZTenJuSim5

Covid-19 vaccines have been highly effective and very safe, but for a small minority the side effects have been serious, leaving governments grappling with how to handle hundreds of injury claims https://t.co/Ny67MJ1fww

“We all used to be like brothers.” People who live in northern Ukraine and other regions bordering Russia are struggling to absorb the idea that a war with Russia could soon be coming. https://t.co/vV4JIlHeNo
Most young adults believe it’s best to delay marriage past your 20s and to live together first. New research challenges both assumptions. https://t.co/JxlUX7EN1w
Manipulative FOMO marketing. An economic structure that benefits early adopters at the expense of newcomers. @mims explains why crypto is the new multilevel marketing. https://t.co/iuH7h3lb4I
For rare individuals known as tetrachromats, who inherit an extra type of cone cell in the eye, the world is more richly colored than most of us can imagine https://t.co/MhuSVBFrD8
Russia test-launches ballistic and cruise missiles as tensions with the West continue to escalate https://t.co/E2ANKiW2Ik
A modeling agent and close associate of the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his prison cell in Paris, French prosecutors said https://t.co/Rc58nY3miN
The U.S. and U.K. plan to review suspected cases of serious vaccine side effects for potential payouts, while Norway has already awarded damages https://t.co/nnIjPD8Z2H
A cargo ship carrying thousands of luxury cars is adrift and on fire in the Atlantic Ocean after the vessel’s crew were evacuated https://t.co/nGYpoOM5Wj
Mark Zuckerberg has a new nickname for his employees: "metamates" https://t.co/mhvjjV3uQ1

Kanye West says his upcoming "Donda 2" album be available only on the Stem Player, a music-playing device he helped develop that costs $200—and won’t be on Apple, Amazon, Spotify or YouTube. "It’s time to free music from this oppressive system," he said. https://t.co/Lv8Z9sh1SB
The U.S. electric grid is becoming less dependable, so more and more Americans are turning to generators, solar panels and microgrids to keep the lights on. https://t.co/CRPxC1gGNt
Simon Leviev, the subject of Netflix's documentary “The Tinder Swindler," has been banned from Tinder along with several other dating apps and websites https://t.co/VnEiQTtkay
Research confirms that Covid-19 vaccinations can affect menstrual cycles, with one recent study linking vaccination to a slight increase in menstrual-cycle length https://t.co/kAyAPG1rIZ
The role of women in Ukraine’s military has undergone a transformation since a pro-Russian insurgency sparked conflict in 2014. Women now make up some 15% of the armed forces. https://t.co/ViIr8bEmj0

“We all used to be like brothers.” People who live in northern Ukraine and other regions bordering Russia are struggling to absorb the idea that a war with Russia could soon be coming. https://t.co/6gbiy5DTKs
Russian naval exercises in the Black Sea threaten to choke off agricultural exports from Ukraine, which is a major world supplier of corn and wheat https://t.co/HbiV32OmyS

The leaders of two Russian-controlled areas in eastern Ukraine urged civilians to evacuate immediately to Russia on Friday as officials in Washington warned that Moscow was preparing for an invasion and looking for an excuse to start hostilities https://t.co/UL0qzpBsml
Former President Donald Trump had classified government records at his Mar-a-Lago residence, the National Archives confirmed, saying it had informed the Justice Department https://t.co/zgMBTtLsT8
A Russian attack on Ukraine is expected in the next few days, U.S. officials warn. It could involve tanks, fighter jets, missiles and a cyber strike. https://t.co/wOf410Ot0z
Enormous resources and local cooperation enable China to suppress infections with less disruption to life than in countries where Covid-19 still rages https://t.co/txVBQTtRaz

The Senate unanimously passed a bill requiring Supreme Court justices and federal judges to promptly post their stock trades following a WSJ investigation, clearing way for a new law https://t.co/BxsJg80Oou

Globally, Ford is now putting out nearly as many all-electric Mustangs as gas-powered ones. Auto columnist Dan Neil breaks down why Mach-E buyers might choose it over the comparable Tesla. https://t.co/ZxZ3TfQXuw
The leader of a Russian-controlled region of eastern Ukraine urged civilians to evacuate to Russia immediately as shelling intensified along the front line https://t.co/gidntperbe

Hong Kong’s Covid-19 strategy is unraveling and the city is likely to witness a significant death toll soon. How the city reached this point says a lot about its changing politics-and future. https://t.co/1yM9PWzeDA
Ukraine said its troops have been issued orders to exercise restraint in responding to artillery fire so as to not give Russia a pretext to invade https://t.co/F11mrXxZZI
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/6zhcdx7e2D https://t.co/oe3TLuzNNd
Elon Musk tweeted and later deleted a meme comparing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to Adolf Hitler https://t.co/uhnpxTozWt

Tesla is being investigated by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration over customer complaints that the company’s most popular vehicles brake for unexpected reasons https://t.co/vmm0RdS4Sv

Former Attorney General Loretta Lynch is representing the National Football League in the racial-discrimination lawsuit filed by former Miami Dolphins coach Brian Flores, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/ykVEFca4wR
Elon Musk tweeted and later deleted a meme comparing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to Adolf Hitler https://t.co/Bef9p3IcxE

Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned of a looming Russian offensive against Ukraine and proposed a last-ditch diplomatic meeting with his Russian counterpart next week that could lead to a potential summit of key leaders https://t.co/1L8VPnjfrN
Breaking: Donald Trump and two of his adult children must testify as part of New York's investigation into the former president and his company, a judge ruled https://t.co/8RzOrEjM4D

Pro-Russian separatists and Ukrainian authorities traded allegations of cease-fire violations along the tense front line separating the two sides, as Western officials said Moscow continued to mass troops along the border of its smaller neighbor https://t.co/55fmzSRFzk

The U.S. Justice Department is pursuing a wide-ranging investigation of short-sellers and potentially manipulative trading tactics meant to drive down shares, people familiar say https://t.co/UwnIU354K9
El Salvador made bitcoin legal tender and is issuing a $1 billion sovereign bond, but the IMF warns bitcoin is too risky, and Salvadorans are mostly sticking to dollars https://t.co/DrgegVYIoC
Twitter’s new CEO Parag Agrawal is planning to take a few weeks of paternity leave following the birth of he and his wife's second child https://t.co/vlnx4dXp6s
The U.S. has repeatedly called on Saudi Arabia to pump more oil to reduce gasoline prices. The Saudis have said no, sticking to an oil deal struck with Russia. https://t.co/YUgpd7mCA7

From @WSJopinion: Putin made his bed. It’s not a U.S. job to help him stay in power or postpone the sudden violent ending that such regimes typically are prey to, writes @HolmanJenkins. No concessions, no rewards. https://t.co/auYrBj5rkp
